paper.title: On the Power of Non-Observable Actions in Timed Automata
paper.venue: Symposium on Theoretical Aspects of Computer Science
paper.abstract: Timed finite automata, introduced by Alur and Dill, are one of the most widely studied models for real-time systems. We focus in this paper on the power of silent transitions, i.e. e-transitions, in such automata. We show that e-transitions strictly increase the power of timed automata and that the class of timed languages recognized by automata with e-transitions is much more robust than the corresponding class without e-transitions. Our main result shows that these transitions increase the power of these automata only if they reset clocks.
